Class Space_Object

java.lang.Object
  Space_Object

public class Space_Object
extends Object

Class Space_Object - an object that exists in a finite Universe. The object bounces off the bottom edge of the universe. And interact with other items in the universe (Planets, Stars etc..)

Version:
2016.01.22
Author:
Robert Topp & Thomas Chate

Constructor Detail

Space_Object

public Space_Object(int xPos,
                    int yPos,
                    int xVel,
                    int yVel,
                    int objectDiameter,
                    Color objectColor,
                    Universe theUniverse,
                    int typeNumber,
                    int probability)
Constructor for objects of class Space_Object

Parameters:
xPos - the horizontal coordinate of the object
yPos - the vertical coordinate of the object
xVel - the horizontal speed of the object
yVel - the vertical speed of the object
objectDiameter - the diameter (in pixels) of the object
objectColor - the color of the object
theUniverse - the universe this object is in
typeNumber - the type number of the object. In this demo it can be 1 or 4.
probability - the probabilty of changing when moving, out of 100.
repeatFactor - the amount of times a comet has moved towards a black hole, it influences speed.

Space_Object

public Space_Object(int xPos,
                    int yPos,
                    int xVel,
                    int yVel,
                    int objectDiameter,
                    Color objectColor,
                    Universe theUniverse,
                    int typeNumber,
                    int probability,
                    int time)
Constructor for objects of class Space_Object

Parameters:
xPos - the horizontal coordinate of the object
yPos - the vertical coordinate of the object
xVel - the horizontal speed of the object
yVel - the vertical speed of the object
objectDiameter - the diameter (in pixels) of the object
objectColor - the color of the object
theUniverse - the universe this object is in
typeNumber - the type number of the object. In this demo it can be 1 or 4.
probability - the probabilty of changing when moving, out of 100.
time - the lifetime of the comet.

cometCollisonDetector

public void cometCollisonDetector(ArrayList<Space_Object> comets,
                                  ArrayList<Planet> planets,
                                  ArrayList<Star> stars,
                                  ArrayList<Black_Hole> holes)
Parameters:
comets - An Arraylist storing all comets in the current universe.
planets - An Arraylist storing all planets in the current universe.
planets - An Arraylist storing all stars in the current universe.
planets - An Arraylist storing all black holes in the current universe. This method handles the interaction between comits, planets, stars and black holes.

move

public void move()
Move this object according to its position and speed and redraw. It also checks to see if the comet has hit a side. If it has it changes it's x&y speed. It also checks to see what type of comet it is. Dependant on this, and its probabilty, 'special' changes occur.

returnDistance

public double returnDistance(int aXPosition,
                             int bXPosition,
                             int aYPosition,
                             int bYPosition)
Returns the comet type for the object.

Parameters:
aXPosition - x coord of the first object
bXPosition - x coord of the second object
aYPosition - y coord of the first object
bYPosition - y coord of the second object.
